description: For the period from 850 to 1850 CE impose boundary conditions of solar variations, volcanic aerosols, atmospheric concentration of well-mixed greenhouse gases, land use and orbital parameters.  Run for 1000 years after spin-up period.
rationale: Evaluate the ability of models to capture observed variability on multi-decadal and longer time-scales.  Determine what fraction of the variability is attributable to "external" forcing and what fraction reflects purely internal variability.  Provide a longer-term perspective for detection and attribution studies.
